availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Eugenie Caroline Gardner Turner in Louisville, Kentucky, on May 20, 1855. Father of Henry Turner. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860. Owned twenty-nine enslaved persons in Ballard County in 1850. Owned forty-six enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 127.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, McCuistans District, p. 181.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, McCuistans District, p. 25.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000819602.
Find A Grave, "Oscar Turner, Sr (February 3, 1825-January 22, 1896)," Memorial #7095874, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7095874 (accessed July 17, 2018).
